intro: Senecio eruciformis var. eruciformis, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
